comment.author: 63945826@N06
comment._content:
Some of the above attribution is incorrect:

The landscape architect was Jacques Greber; Horace Trumbauer was the architect of the mansion itself.

The construction of the house and gardens was started by George and Eleanor Widener; George perished in the sinking of the Titanic, and Mrs. Widener (who was rescued) completed the project, later remarrying Dr. Alexander Hamilton Rice - hence the two "creator" names above.

Sincerely, 

Susannah
Smithsonian Institution Archives

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: The Landscape Architect has been updated! All this information and more can be found with the original Miramar [slide] record. Sorry for any confusion. Thank you for your patience. Susannah
